step.text: Follow this step-by-step assembly instructions to build your TROUBLEMAKER 3D PRINTER. Perform each step following assembly step description with photo demonstration. Video tutorials for each step will be included shortly. We highly recommend you follow the assembling steps in the suggested order.
Prepare the 3D printed parts carriage bottom, carriage top, carriage rod cover and carriage tensioner.

Re-drill all smaller holes on all parts with a 3mm drill. There are 8 holes on carriage bottom parts, 5 holes on carriage top parts, 2 holes on carriage rod cover parts and 1 hole on carriage tensioner parts.
Re-drill a big hole on carriage bottom parts with a 12mm drill.
In the next steps the assembly of one carriage will be described. The steps have to be repeated four times to assemble four carriages that are required in the 3D printer.

Insert M3 square nuts in the slots on the carriage bottom part. There are 7 nuts required. You can help yourself with a slotted screwdriver if necessary. After you have inserted the square nuts, screw the set screw in the hole at the side of the carriage bottom part with the square nut inserted, but don't tighten it yet.
Insert M3 square nut in the slot on the carriage tensioner part. You can help yourself with a slotted screwdriver if necessary.

Insert the brass bushing and tighten the set screw. When inserting the bushing you have to bo careful that you position the bushing in a way that the set screw won't damage any of the graphite parts when tightened but will insted tighten against the brass part of the bushing.
Take the timing belt and insert it between carriage bottom and carriage top parts. Take TORX screws M3x35 and screw the carriage together. Don't tighten the screws yet.
The steps 5 to 8 have to be repeated four times to assemble four carriages that are required in the 3D printer.
Prepare the 3D printed parts extruder, extruder bearing holder, extruder bearing axis flange, extruder rod and extruder thumbwheel M3.
Break the flange of the extruder bearing axis part.
Cut the M3 thread in two holes on extruder part as seen in the picture.
Cut the 1/8" thread in the hole for the pneumatic coupler.
Re-drill two holes for filament on extruder part with a 2mm drill and two holes for fixing on the housing with a 5mm drill.
Re-drill four holes for stepper motor on extruder part, both holes on extruder rod part and one hole on extruder thumbwheel M3 part with a 3mm drill.
Screw the push-fit pneumatic coupling in the extruder part.
Screw the extruder rod part to the extruder part with two screws. Do not overtighten the screws.
Attach the filament drive gear on the stepper motor.
Attach the stepper motor on the extruder with four screws.
Insert the M3 square nut in the extruder part as seen in the picture.
Push the extruder bearing axis through ball bearing and attach it to the extruder bearing holder part.
Put extruder thumbwheel M3 part on HEX bolt, add two washers and a spring and put everything in the extruder bearing holder part as shown in the picture.
Attach the extruder bearing holder part to the extruder part with the HEX bolt.
Connect the stepper motor cable to the stepper motor.

parts.part: 1x stepper motor cable with dupont connector

step.text: Prepare the parts print bed bottom and print bed top, cut from aluminium.

Take the aluminium print bed bottom and attach linear ball bearings with HEX socket screws. Because the print bed bottom part is not symetrical, be careful to position it as seen in the picture. The wider wing for the front linear ball bearings has to be on the right side.
Attach ball screw with HEX socket screws as seen in the picture.
Take the 3D printed print bed level bolts holders. Cut the M3 thread in two holes as seen in the picture.
Take the aluminium print bed top, insert the HEX bolts and secure them with print bed level bolts holders. Attach each print bed level bolts holder with two TORX screws.

Put a spring and two M4 washers on each HEX bolt and connect print bed top and print bed bottom parts. Put one M4 washer and one M4 spring lock washer on each HEX bolt and secure all parts together with M4 wing nuts.
Take heater pad and lengthen the wires. Solder thermistor cable with dupont connector to the black wire and 2x2.5mm² cable to the red cables.
Take binder clips and loosen them a bit.
Take print bed cork plate, heater pad and print bed glass plate and attach them all to the print bed top part using binder clips.
Secure the cables in place with a cable tie and and cut off the extra tail with the cutter pliers..
Prepare the 3D printed parts print head, print head clamp and print head clips.
Cut the M3 thread in four holes at the back of the print head part and two holes on each side of the print head part as seen in the picture.
Re-drill two big holes for bushings on print head part with a 12mm drill. Re-drill the hole on the top of the print head part with a 4mm drill and the hole underneath it with a 6mm drill.
Re-drill all smaller holes without the M3 thread on all parts with a 3mm drill. There are 10 holes on print head part, 4 holes on head clamp part and 2 holes on head clip parts.
Insert four M3 square nuts in the slots. You can help yourself with a slotted screwdriver if necessary.

Insert two more M3 square nuts in the slots. You can help yourself with a slotted screwdriver if necessary. After you have inserted the square nuts, screw the set screws in the holes, but don't tighten them yet.

Insert the brass bushings and tighten the set screws. When inserting the bushings you have to bo careful that you position the bushings in a way that the set screws won't damage any of the graphite parts when tightened but will insted tighten against the brass part of the bushings.
Attach the cooling fan using four TORX screws.
Take the E3D v6 hot end parts and assemble them by the instructions available on the E3D website - http://wiki.e3d-online.com/wiki/E3D-v6_Assembly.
Take the assembled E3D v6 hot end. Attach it to the print head part and secure it with print head clamp part and four TORX screws.
Secure the cables in place with print head clip part and two TORX screws. Screw the other print head clip part on the other side of the print head part using two TORX screws.
Direct the wires through the hole in the print head part. Cut all the cables to the appropriate length and strip the ends of the wires.

Take the LiY(St)Y cable and strip the ends of the wires. Direct the cable through the hole in the print head part, as seen in the picture. Solder the wires together:
red wire (0.5mm²) = heater
black wire (0.5mm²) = heater
red wire (0.22mm²) = fan +
grey wire (0.22mm²) = fan -
green wire (0.22mm²) = thermistor
yellow wire (0.22mm²) = thermistor
brown wire (0.22mm²) = /
blue wire (0.22mm²) = /
orange wire (0.22mm²) = /
white wire (0.22mm²) = /
Fix the cables with the cable ties and cut off the extra tails with the cutter pliers.
Prepare all housing parts, cut from plywood.

When assembling the housing you have to be careful because the parts are not symetrical. Take the housing right part and put it on the table as seen in the picture. Put the housing bottom and housing top parts in the desgined slots, but be careful because the parts are not symetrical. The 12mm holes for the smooth rods are a bit off center and the parts have to be turned in a way that those holes are more away from the main housing right plate. Place the housing left part on top of all parts an push housing bottom and housing top parts in the slots.
Attach housing front and housing back parts as seen in the picture.
Connect the parts of the housing together using TORX screws and thin nuts.
Attach the pillow block ball bearings to the housing with the HEX socket screws.
Attach filament spool holder cover parts on the back of the housing with TORX screws as seen in the pictures.
Prepare the 3D printed parts electronics cover stopper. Re-drill all holes with a 3mm drill. There are 3 holes on each part.
Insert three M3 square nuts in the slots on each part. You can help yourself with a slotted screwdriver if necessary.
Attach both parts with TORX screws to the bottom of housing back part as seen in the picture.
Prepare the 3D printed parts rod z holder. Re-drill a big hole with a 12mm drill. Re-drill all smaller holes with a 3mm drill. There is 1 big and 8 smaller holes on each part.

Insert eight M3 square nuts in the slots on each part. You can help yourself with a slotted screwdriver if necessary. After you have inserted the square nuts, screw two TORX screws in holes on each part, but don't tighten them yet.
Attach both parts on the housing front, housing left and housing right parts with TORX screws as seen in the picture.
Prepare limit switches. Cut the M3 thread in two holes on each limit switch. Solder endstop cables on limit switches as seen in the picture.
Take limit switches with hinge lever and limit switch spacer parts and screw them on the slots on the housing left and housing front. Direct the cables through the groove on the rod z holder parts.
Take limit switch pin plunger and screw it on the slots on the top of housing back.
Take two NEMA17 steppers. Attach timing belt pulley with a 5mm bore on each stepper as seen in the picture.

parts.part: 2x stepper motor cable with dupont connector

step.text: Take stepper spacer parts. Use hook on the stepper spacer cables part to secure stepper motor cables.
Attach stepper motors together with the stepper spacers on housing using TORX screws. Use stepper tensioner parts as seen in the picture.
Take NEMA17 stepper. Attach flexible coupling on the stepper as seen in the picture.

parts.part: 1x stepper motor cable with dupont connector

step.text: Attach stepper motor on housing using TORX screws. Attach it on the bottom side of housing bottom part as seen in the picture.
Take the longer four smooth rods fi8 and insert them through pillow block ball bearings on the housing. The shorter two are laying on the x axis and the longer two on the y axis.

Take the assembled carriages and place one carriage and two timing belt pulleys with a 8mm bore on each smooth rod. Place one more belt pulleys with a 8mm bore and timing belt with 100 teeth on the right and back smooth rod for stepper motors. Direct those two timing belts on the belt pulleys with a 5mm bore that are attached to the steppers.

Direct the timing belts that are attached to the carriages around the belt pulleys in a loop and connect them back to the carriages using carriage tensioner part, as seen in the picture. TORX screw on the carriage has to be tightened so that the carriage tensioner part slides into the carriage, but don't fully tighten the screw yet.
Tighten the set screws on the pillow block ball bearings to secure the smooth rods in place.
Attach rod z cover parts on the bottom of the housing bottom.

Take the assembled print bed and place it inside the housing. Take the longer two smooth rods fi12 and slide them from the top of the housing through the holes in the housing top and through the linear ball bearings. Attach the rod z cover parts on the top of the smooth rods to secure them in place.

Take the shorter two smooth rods fi12 and slide them from the bottom of the housing through the holes in the housing bottom and through the front linear ball bearings. Attach the rod z cover parts to secure the smooth rods in place. Tighten the TORX screws on the rod z holder parts.

Connect the ball screw to the stepper motor using flexible coupling. You have to push the ball screw all the way into the flexible coupling so that the ball screw and the stepper motor shaft are touching. Secure it with the set screw as seen in the picture.

Take the ball screw holder part and a pillow block ball bearing. Attach the pillow block ball bearing on the ball screw holder using HEX screws as seen in the picture. Insert the three square nuts in the slots. You can help yourself with a slotted screwdriver if necessary.
Using TORX screws attach the assembled part to the housing. Secure the ball screw in place.
Attach the print head on the housing with the shortest two smooth rods fi8. Secure them in place with the carriage rod cover parts and TORX screws. Connect the bowden to the print head
Attach the extruder with HEX screws. Cut the bowden to the right lenght and connect the other end to the extruder.
Direct all the wires for the extruder, print head and steppers through the holes in the hosuing back and housing bottom.
Prepare the 24V power supply for the heated bed and attach the custom relay for heated bed.
Attach the power supply to the housing using HEX screws. All electronic components are attached on the bottom of the housing bottom part.
Attach the 24V power supply for RUMBA board using TORX screws.
Attach the relay with TORX screws.
Prepare the RUMBA board and set the microstepping for X, Y, Z and E0 steppers to 1/16 with the dip switches set to 001.
Prepare stepper drivers and stepper driver heatsinks. Attach the heatsinks to the stepper drivers as seen in the picture.
Connect the stepper drivers to the RUMBA board as seen in the picture. Make sure that the RUMBA power input selector is set to "stand alone".
Attach four hex stand-offs to the RUMBA board. Attach RUMBA to the housing bottom part using TORX screws.
Attach four hex stand-offs to the full graphic smart LCD controller. Attach LCD controller to the housing bottom part using TORX screws.
Insert the SD card into the slot on the LCD controller.

Connect the LCD controller and the RUMBA board. You have to connect EXP1 from the LCD controller to EXP2 on RUMBA and EXP2 from the LCD controller to EXP1 on RUMBA. You also have to flip the connector so it is connected upside down.
Prepare the 240V IEC inlet and two 5A fuses. Insert the fuses in the IEC inlet as seen in the picture.
Prepare 1.5mm² cable, 10cm in lenght. Crimp blade connectors on both sides of the cable using terminal crimping tool as seen in the picture.
Connect the two pins of the IEC inlet with the cable as seen in the picture.

Prepare two 1.5mm² cables, 10cm and 20cm in lenght. Crimp a blade connector on one side of the 10cm cable using terminal crimping tool. Crimp a ferrule terminal on one side of the 20cm cable using ferrule crimping tool. Join other sides of both cables together and crimp a blade connector on the cables using terminal crimping tool as seen in the picture.
Connect the cable on the IEC inlet as seen in the picture.

Prepare two 1.5mm² cables, 20cm in lenght. Crimp a blade connector on one side of each cable using terminal crimping tool and a ferrule terminal on other side of each cable using ferrule crimping tool as seen in the picture.
Connect the cables on the IEC inlet as seen in the picture.
Attach the IEC inlet to the side of the housing using philips screws.

Connect the neutral wire (blue) and the ground wire (green-yellow) from IEC inlet to the 24V power supply for the heated bed. Connect the line wire (brown) from IEC inlet to one of the AC conections on the DC AC solid state relay.
Prepare 1.5mm² cable, 20cm in lenght. Crimp ferrule terminals on both sides of the cable using ferrule crimping tool as seen in the picture.
Connect the cable to the 24V power supply for the heated bed on one end and to the second of the AC conections on the DC AC solid state relay.
Prepare 3x1.5mm² cable, 30cm in lenght. Crimp ferrule terminals on all wires using ferrule crimping tool as seen in the picture.
Using the 3x2.5mm² cable, connect the 24V power supply for the heated bed and the 24V power supply for RUMBA board.
Prepare 3x1.5mm² cable, 45cm in lenght. Cutt one of the wires using cutter pliers. Crimp ferrule terminals on the remainig wires using ferrule crimping tool as seen in the picture.
Prepare push button and connect the 3x1.5mm² cable to it.
Attach the push button to the housing as seen in the picture.
Connect to the other ends of the 3x1.5mm² cable to the AC conections on the DC AC solid state relay as seen in the picture.

Prepare two 2x0.75mm² cables, 35cm in lenght. Crimp ferrule terminals on one side of each cable using ferrule crimping tool. Join other sides of both cables together and crimp ferrule terminals on the cables using ferrule crimping tool as seen in the picture.
Connect the RUMBA board ("MAIN PWR" and "HB PWR") with the 24V power supply for RUMBA board.
Connect the stepper motors to the RUMBA board ("X", "Y", "Z" and "E0") as seen in the picture.
Connect the limit switches to the RUMBA board ("X-", "Y-" and "Z-") as seen in the picture.
Prepare thermistor cable with dupont connector and cut it to size, 40cm in lenght. Crimp ferrule terminals on the wires using ferrule crimping tool as seen in the picture.
Connect the "PS ON" pins on the RUMBA board to the DC conections on the DC AC solid state relay using the thermistor cable with dupont connector as seen in the picture.

Prepare thermistor cable with dupont connector and cut it to size, 5cm in lenght. Solder it to the other end of the LiY(St)Y cable for the print head, to the green and yellow wires (0.22mm²). Cut the leftover cables of the thermistor cable with dupont connector to 40cm lenght and crimp ferrule terminals on one end of the wires using ferrule crimping tool. Solder the other end of the cables to the red and grey wires (0.22mm²). Crimp ferrule terminals on the red and black wires (0.5mm²) using ferrule crimping tool.

The wires should be soldered together as follows:
red wire (0.5mm²) = ferrule terminal
black wire (0.5mm²) = ferrule terminal
red wire (0.22mm²) = extended + ferrule terminal
grey wire (0.22mm²) = extended + ferrule terminal
green wire (0.22mm²) = thermistor cable with dupont connector
yellow wire (0.22mm²) = thermistor cable with dupont connector
brown wire (0.22mm²) = /
blue wire (0.22mm²) = /
orange wire (0.22mm²) = /
white wire (0.22mm²) = /
Connect the print head heater (red and black 0.5mm² wires) to the RUMBA board ("HE0").
Connect the print head thermistor (green and yellow 0.22mm² wires) to the RUMBA board ("T0").
Connect the print head fan (red and gray 0.22mm² wires) to the 24V power supply for RUMBA board.
Prepare 2x0.75mm² cable, 50cm in lenght. Crimp ferrule terminals on both sides of the cable using ferrule crimping tool as seen in the picture.
Connect the RUMBA board ("HB OUT") with the heated bed relay as seen in the picture.
Connect the heated bed with the heated bed relay as seen in the picture.
Connect the heated bed thermistor to the RUMBA board ("THB") as seen in the picture.
Using cable ties, secure the cables in place. There are several holes for the cable ties on the housing bottom part.
Prepare the housing electronics cover part, cut from plywood.
Attach two fans with grills using TORX screws. Secure the cables with cable ties.
Prepare the thermistor cable with dupont connector and cut it to 50cm lenght. Solder wires for both fans togethen to a thermistor cable. Secure all cables with cable ties.
Connect the fan cable to the RUMBA board.
Cover the electronics with the housing electronics cover part. Secure it in place using TORX screws.
Prepare filament spool holder middle 1kg, filament spool holder side 1kg and filament spool holder hook parts. Assemble the filament spool holder using TORX screws as seen in the picture.
Repeat it with filament spool holder 2kg parts. Attach the desired filament spool holder to the housing back part.
Prepare plexi magnet parts. Re-drill all holes with a 3mm drill. There is one hole on each part.
Insert magnets and square nuts into the plexi magnet parts using tongue-and-groove pliers.
Attach the plexi magnet parts to the housing with TORX screws.
Prepare plexi handle parts. Cut the M3 thread in the hole on each part.

Prepare all hosuing cover parts, cut from plexi. Cut the M3 thread in four holes on each part and screw philips screws in them. Re-drill the remaining hole on each part with a 3mm drill and attach plexi handle parts with TORX screws.
Attach the housing cover parts to the housing.
THIS SECTION WILL BE AVAILABLE SOON.
